1.title: Jim Attends The March For Our Lives
1.plot: Jim looks at the GOP's attempts to ignore the gun debate, attends a March For Our Lives rally and explains why teens are so successful at advocating for gun control.

2.title: Day Drinking with the Press
2.plot: Jim makes the case for decriminalizing sex work, discusses press freedom with White House reporters and looks at the Trump administration's efforts to modify the census.

3.title: Scott Pruitt's Biggest Scandal
3.plot: Jim breaks down the Oklahoma teachers' strike, tries desperately to get Noel Gallagher to like him and examines EPA chief Scott Pruitt's religious worldview.

4.title: Comey's Nasty Little Tell-All
4.plot: Jim questions President Trump's motives for bombing Syria, breaks down former FBI Chief James Comey's gossipy memoir and sits down with "Rampage" star Malin Akerman.

5.title: Ireland's Abortion Ban
5.plot: Jim proposes a test for curbing overpopulation, heads across the pond to challenge Ireland's draconian abortion laws and meets a teacher with controversial views on slavery.

6.title: Questioning Trump's North Korea Strategy
6.plot: Jim has questions about the seemingly positive developments out of North Korea and South Korea, examines the toxic culture of "incels" with the help of the Slayer guitarist Kerry King, and checks in with his kooky weatherman.

7.title: The Exploitation of NFL Cheerleaders
7.plot: Jim looks at all the ways the NFL mistreats its cheerleaders, chats with Carol Burnett about the state of comedy and refutes conservative hysteria over asylum-seekers.

8.title: Learning About the Royal Family
8.plot: Jim explains why torture is simply wrong, seeks answers about the British royal family and looks for a middle ground between helicopter parenting and neglect.

9.title: Why Scared White People Keep Calling 911
9.plot: Jim breaks down a recent wave of racial profiling incidents, chats with comedian W. Kamau Bell about being profiled and looks at how bogus support animals undermine real ones.

10.title: The Sex Robot Revolution
10.plot: Jim questions the public demand for insincere apologies, meets a scientist at the forefront of sex robot technology, and weighs the pros and cons of gene editing.

11.title: Jordan Peterson & Sarah Silverman
11.plot: Jim analyzes Trump's feud with America's allies, tackles free speech with anti-SJW activist Jordan Peterson, Peterson's critics and Sarah Silverman, and pays (in)appropriate tribute to Jerry Maren, the late Wizard of Oz Munchkin.

12.title: The Crisis at the US - Mexico Border
12.plot: Jim shows the damage that putting small children of undocumented immigrants in government camps is doing to them, interviews a former employee there, analyzes Russia's aggressive anti-gay stance, and spotlights Ruso, ND (population: 4).

13.title: Judging the Supreme Court
13.plot: Jeff takes on the U.S. Supreme Court, the latest sea-killing island of human-produced garbage, and a group of Irishmen who don't want limits to their drinking. He also gives props to an environmentally-conscious Islamic terrorist group.

14.title: America's Number One
14.plot: Jim questions America's obsession with greatness, tackles toxic masculinity, chats with the king of curmudgeon comedians, Bill Burr, and gives his thoughts on FIFA's protest over TV cameras ogling the female spectators.

15.title: Comic-Con's Diversity Problem
15.plot: Jeff mocks the corporate giants that abuse their workers, the public's indifference to it, the idea that Kylie Jenner is a self-made businesswoman, an anti-SJW comic fan, and the couple who had their baby in Chick-Fil-A's bathroom.

16.title: America Reaches Peak Outrage
16.plot: Jeff condemns the practice of calling out celebrities like James Gunn over their controversial old tweets, analyzes why so many Americans today feel unhappy, and argues with "Intactivists" who protest against male circumcision.

17.title: The 1D Brain Behind 3D-Printed Guns
17.plot: Jim shows concern over 3D-printed guns and the incredible inefficiency of the TSA, interviews a rising star in the Democratic Party, U.S. Representative Barbara Lee, and stands up for the police dog that the Colombian cartels want dead.

18.title: Life During Trump's Topsy-Turvy Presidency
18.plot: Jim mocks the failed 2018 Unite the Right rally, analyzes Trump's ability to get away even with stuff like promoting asbestos, has a politically incorrect Q&A with the audience, and the show's new weatherman lobbies for coal and oil.

19.title: What is QAnon?
19.plot: Jim supports the supposed death of marriage, interviews four popular pro-Trump QAnon conspiracy theorists, criticizes the exploitative practice of tipping in America, and warns of weed killing chemicals found in breakfast cereals.

20.title: Jim's Deep Dive Into Religion
20.plot: Jim shows how the right to religious freedom is often abused to curb the rights of others, has a pint and a chat with a priest, a rabbi and an imam in a bar, challenges an anti-atheist pastor, and gets scolded by the show's weatherman.

21.title: Nike's Ad Campaign Stirs Up Controversy
21.plot: Jim breaks down Nike's controversial ad campaign featuring Colin Kaepernick, questions the definition of "liberal Hollywood elite," goes cruising for crime with two Amsterdam cops and introduces the ironic "Aw, It's Not So Bad" segment.

22.title: Republicans Stand By Brett Kavanaugh
22.plot: Jim questions the GOP's unwavering support for Supreme Court nominee Brett Kavanaugh, dissects America's obsession with work, meets a nudist fighting for her religious freedom and asks (almost) everyone to register to vote in midterms.

23.title: America's Racist Criminal Justice System
23.plot: Jim breaks down California's attempt to reform the cash bail system, looks at the racial disparities in criminal sentencing, has a pint and a chat with four political consultants about the 2018 midterms, and angers the show's weatherman.

24.title: The Exploitation of Victimhood
24.plot: Jim asks Bob Saget who the real victims in recent political and sex scandals are, questions the usefulness of calling one's senator, quizzes random Americans and Brits about US politics, and ridicules extreme baby gender reveal parties.

25.title: The Downward Spiral of Climate Change
25.plot: Jim tries to care about the latest climate change news warning of soon-to-be-uninhabitable Earth and recycle. He also interviews NBA legend Kareem Abdul-Jabbar, and the show's weatherman celebrates global warming with CHEM energy drink.

26.title: Why Healthy Living Is Impossible
26.plot: Jim criticizes the modern day obsession with being pretty, finds it impossible to actually follow the countless tips for healthy living, rewrites the U.S. Constitution to make it more practical, and "Aw, It's Not So Bad" segment returns.

27.title: How Right Wing Rhetoric Leads to Violence
27.plot: Jim explains how toxic right wing rhetoric leads to real life violence, interviews a guy who spanks kids and a woman who opposes it, warns of smart technology spying on users, and agrees that "blackface" is not a Halloween costume.

28.title: Third-Party Debate: The Best of the Rest
28.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

29.title: Trump Wages War Against Journalists
29.plot: Jim criticizes the idea of colonizing Mars, supports the conservationists' efforts to get the world to stop using paper, interviews White House correspondent April Ryan, and stars in his own action-packed trailer for Heathrow T5 transit.

30.title: Jim Becomes a U.S. Citizen
30.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

0.title: Unaired Pilot
0.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

1.title: Worldwide Racism
1.plot: Jim kicks off his first show by highlighting President Trump's affection for dictators, tackling racism in the U.S. and investigating Holland's Black Pete tradition.

2.title: Unpacking Impeachment
2.plot: Jim gives his take on Qatar's sudden isolation in the Middle East, examines the process of impeachment in the U.S. and pays a visit to Melania Trump's hometown in Slovenia.

3.title: Criminal Injustice
3.plot: Jim reacts to Bill Cosby's mistrial, chats with Azerbaijan Ambassador Elin Suleymanov and weighs in on the prevalence of capital punishment in the U.S.

4.title: Health Care Unhinged
4.plot: Jim digs into the high costs and low benefits of the Senate Republicans' health care bill, then pays a visit to right-wing Australian Senator Pauline Hanson.

5.title: Understanding the First Amendment
5.plot: Jim highlights major vacancies in U.S. government agencies, chats with a group of conspiracy theorists and explores dicey First Amendment issues.

6.title: America's Age of Unenlightenment
6.plot: Jim reacts to Kid Rock's possible Senate run, learns about the problems plaguing Australia's Great Barrier Reef and examines the politicized climate change debate.

7.title: Trophy Hunter Takedown
7.plot: The GOP brings dead debates back to life, Comic-Con cosplayers weigh in on political issues, and the death of Cecil the Lion's son sends Jim into a fury about trophy hunting.

8.title: The Fight for LGBTQ Military Rights
8.plot: Jim offers much-needed advice to the Democratic Party, describes the history of anti-LGBTQ discrimination in the U.S. military and chats with former CIA officer Evan McMullin.

9.title: The Threat of Nuclear War
9.plot: Jim breaks down the possibility of a nuclear war with North Korea, questions the arguments against euthanasia, chats with angry comedian Bill Burr, and makes a video job application for the position of NASA's Planetary Protection Officer.

10.title: Charlottesville White Supremacist Rally
10.plot: Jim addresses Charlottesville's violent white supremacist rally, explores the Confederate monument debate and unpacks Donald Trump's new immigration policy.

11.title: Jim's Police Ride-Along
11.plot: Jim goes on a ride-along with police in the U.K., takes aim at Hurricane Harvey's wannabe vigilantes, and sits down with the mayor who created "Anti-Jim Jefferies Day".

12.title: Trump's Anti-NFL Freakout
12.plot: Jim examines President Trump's beef with protesting athletes, highlights the scourge of traumatic brain injuries among NFL players and discusses health care with Andy Slavitt.

13.title: Trump's Bungled Puerto Rico Response
13.plot: Jim highlights Trump's tone-deaf reaction to Hurricane Maria, breaks down the administration's spate of travel scandals and talks free speech with the Insane Clown Posse.

14.title: Hawaii's One-Party System
14.plot: Jim looks at ISIS's desperate attempt to take credit for the Las Vegas shooting, the Hawaiian GOP's internal divide and America's laughably outdated banking system.

15.title: Trump's Congressional Twitter Troll
15.plot: Jim challenges men to do better in the wake of the Harvey Weinstein scandal, chats with a congressman popular for taunting the president and examines Russia's propaganda.

16.title: America's Opioid Epidemic
16.plot: Jim highlights the growing opioid epidemic in the U.S., examines binge-drinking on college campuses and sits down with "The Death of Expertise" author Tom Nichols.

17.title: After School Satan Club
17.plot: Jim delves into the Mueller indictments, tries to help a struggling after-school club run by Satanists and rips into Republicans' too-late response to Donald Trump.

18.title: Mark Cuban vs. Donald Trump
18.plot: Jim revisits forgotten news stories, examines the Trump administration's discriminatory religious liberty guidelines and pitches an invention to "Shark Tank" star Mark Cuban.

19.title: Roy Moore's Sexual Assault Allegations
19.plot: Jim examines the GOP's reluctance to drop accused child molester Roy Moore from the Senate ballot and talks with Rob Reiner about sexual harassment in Hollywood and beyond.

20.title: Let's Talk About Guns
20.plot: Jim criticizes Trump's tax plan, discusses gun control with the former Navy SEAL who killed Osama bin Laden, joins him at a shooting range to learn why Americans love guns so much, and reads up on the gruesome real legacy of Thanksgiving.

imdb.title: The Jim Jefferies Show
plot: No-holds-barred Aussie comedian Jim Jefferies hosts his satirical weekly U.S. talk show, covering the news, U.S. politics, pop culture, global issues and whatever else happens to be bothering him at the moment.
